com.yworks.yfiles.graphml

Interface IWriteContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ILookup
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ChildWriteContext

    public interface IWriteContext
extends ILookup
    Interface that provides the context of a GraphML write process.

    All state data that is needed for the writing of a concrete graph instance should go here, allowing all handlers and deserializers to be implemented stateless.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.yworks.yfiles.graph.ILookup

      • getCurrent

        <T> T getCurrent()
        Returns the most current (the last element) within the container hierarchy as it is returned by ObjectStack or default(T) if the most current element is not of the desired target type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The desired target type.
        Returns:
        the most current element within the container hierarchy or default(T).

      • getGraph

        IGraph getGraph()
        Returns the currently active graph object.
        Returns:
        The Graph.

      • getObjectStack

        IListEnumerable<Object> getObjectStack()
        Returns the current nesting of graphs and graph elements.

        The list contains the user objects which correspond to the GraphML elements.

        Returns:
        A read-only view on the current nesting

      • getSerializationProperty

        <T> T getSerializationProperty(TypedKey<T> key)
        Get a property value that specifies information about how to handle specific cases.
        Parameters:
        key - The identifier for the property
        Returns:
        The property value, or null if no such property exists

      • serialize

        default void serialize(Object item,
                       Type t)
                throws SerializationNotSupportedException
        Serializes the specified item using the provided type information.

        item should be assignable to type t. This method simply delegates to serialize(Type, IWriteContext, Object), using the correct type parameter.

        Throws:
        SerializationNotSupportedException
        Parameters:
        item - The item to serialize.
        t - The type the item is known to be of at deserialization time.

      • serialize

        <T> void serialize(Type targetType,
                   IWriteContext context,
                   T item)
            throws SerializationNotSupportedException
        Serialize item to an XML representation.

        Client code should usually use the extension method serialize(Type, Object) instead to ensure the the correct context instance is used.

        Throws:
        SerializationNotSupportedException
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object that is serialized.
        Parameters:
        targetType - The type of the object that is serialized.
        context - The current write context.
        item - The object that should be serialized.
        See Also:
        serialize(Type, Object)

      • serialize

        default <T> void serialize(Type targetType,
                           T item)
                    throws SerializationNotSupportedException
        Serialize the item.

        This method calls serialize(Type, IWriteContext, Object) with context as first argument and should be used in virtually all cases.

        Throws:
        SerializationNotSupportedException
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the object that is serialized.
        Parameters:
        targetType - The type of the object that is serialized.
        item - The object that should be serialized.
        See Also:
        serialize(Type, IWriteContext, Object)

      • serializeReplacement

        default void serializeReplacement(Type targetType,
                                  Object originalItem,
                                  Object replacement)
                           throws SerializationNotSupportedException
        Serialize an replacement object replacement instead of the original originalItem.

        Calling this method allows to remember the original object instance, even if the object is really written through a MarkupExtension or similar replacement mechanisms.

        Throws:
        SerializationNotSupportedException
        Parameters:
        originalItem - The original object that should be serialized.
        replacement - The replacement object that will actually be serialized instead.
        See Also:
        serialize(Type, IWriteContext, Object)
